p:
First, the climate-related uncertainties lead to a difference of 20.5 GtCO 2 in the 2100 CO 2 emission levels corresponding to the upper and lower ends of the likely range for the 2 °C target; this difference is 12.0 GtCO 2 for the 1.5 °C target. The total forcing in 2100 is estimated to be
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$${3.3}_{-0.6}^{+0.6}$$\end{document}
3.3
- 0.6
+ 0.6
Wm −2 for the 2 °C target and
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$${2.5}_{-0.5}^{+0.4}$$\end{document}
2.5
- 0.5
+ 0.4
Wm −2 for the 1.5 °C target.
